definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to swim/variant of 遊|游[you2]
to walk/to tour/to roam/to travel
surname You
edge of blade
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus

sentences.english: Students friends in the industry to find jobs equal to the task.
sentences.chinese: 业大学生朋友们在找工作时游刃有余。

sentences.english: By following that principle I have gotten lucky with changes time and time again.
sentences.chinese: 通过采用这样的原则，我在面对变化时游刃有余。

sentences.english: Loosening up the tightly regulated labor market to make it easier for firms to hire and fire helped.
sentences.chinese: 宽松的劳动力市场监管让他们在就业市场游刃有余。

sentences.english: Chen Sui-born architect with the Ministry of Works about programmes to highly competent.
sentences.chinese: 建筑师出身的陈穗建与工程部谈起方案来游刃有余。

sentences.english: B: Do you know what his technique is that makes him so skilled?
sentences.chinese: 你知道他这样游刃有余到底用的是什么技巧呢？

sentences.english: Mary is neither clever nor stupid, but is good enough at her work.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽既不聪明也不笨，但应付工作游刃有余。

sentences.english: He navigates celebrity dinner galas like a seasoned politician.
sentences.chinese: 他游刃有余地参加名流晚宴，宛如政坛老将。

definition: to handle matters with ease (idiom)/to hold one's own
lit. what the heart wishes, the hand accomplishes (idiom) skilled at the job/entirely in one's element/going smoothly and easily
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
like a fish back in water (idiom); glad to be back in one's proper surroundings
calm/unruffled
to be successful in every endeavor
to go easy/unhurried/calm/Taiwan pr. [cong1 rong2]
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
handling any occasion smoothly (idiom); equal to any situation
seasoned/experienced
unobstructed/unconstrained/smoothly/with ease/freely
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
lit. moving clouds and flowing water (idiom)/fig. very natural and flowing style of calligraphy, writing, etc/natural and unforced
skillful/proficient
to reach perfection (idiom); a superb artistic achievement
lit. the stove fire has turned bright green (allusion to Daoist alchemy) (idiom)/fig. (of an art, a technique etc) brought to the point of perfection
